title: Dow Jones Top Company Headlines at 5 PM ET: American Eagle Expects Boost From Campaigns With Sydney Sweeney, Travis Kelce | Hewlett ... | Morningstar
text:
Dow Jones Top Company Headlines at 5 PM ET: American Eagle Expects Boost From Campaigns With Sydney Sweeney, Travis Kelce | Hewlett ...
American Eagle Expects Boost From Campaigns With Sydney Sweeney, Travis Kelce
The apparel retailer said it expects same-store sales up low-single digits in the third and fourth quarters, resulting in the metric finishing the year about flat.
----
Hewlett Packard Enterprise Is All In on Networks After Juniper Acquisition
The server and cloud-software company 's acquisition of Juniper helped fuel a 54% jump in quarterly networking revenue.
----
Salesforce Reports Solid Earnings but Stock Slides on Outlook
Salesforce was a major player in bringing the cloud revolution. It now seeks the a good answer to the AI revolution.
----
xAI's CFO Steps Down, the Latest in a String of Executive Departures
Mike Liberatore departed after only a few months on the job.
----
Figma Second-Quarter Revenue Jumps as Businesses Spend More on Design
Figma posted a double-digit increase in revenue in its latest quarter as customers continue to spend more money on its design and product-development software.
----
Newsmax Files Antitrust Lawsuit Against Fox News
The conservative cable channel accused its bigger rival of using deals with pay-TV distributors to restrict the access of competitors.
----
Amazon Pauses Delivery Fleet Redeployments After Outcry Over Repair Costs
The e-commerce giant said it would suspend reassignment of vans after delivery-company owners complained about surprise repair bills.
----
ConocoPhillips Is Latest U.S. Oil Producer to Announce Major Layoffs
The driller said it would cut up to a quarter of its workforce, or about 3,250 jobs.
----
Unilever Plans on 'Refreshing' Top Leaders Amid Broad Restructuring
The company will replace about 25% of its top 200 leaders as it aims to improve its performance results.
----
Trump Brothers-Backed Bitcoin Mining Company Surges After Nasdaq Listing
American Bitcoin's public listing comes days after the Trump family made as much as $5 billion on paper from a separate digital token.
----
Former Opendoor CEO Reaps Unlikely Windfall From Meme Rally
Carrie Wheeler, who resigned under pressure in August, filed paperwork giving notice of her intent to sell 7 million Opendoor shares worth roughly $35 million.
----
Ford Sales Rise in August, Led by EVs
Ford reported a 3.9% increase in August sales, including year-over-year growth across all of its car types.
----
How Macy's CEO Tony Spring Is Turning the Retailer Around
The retailer's shares jumped 21% on strong sales, though its CEO cautioned that tariffs could make shoppers more "choiceful."
----
Dollar Tree Shares Fall as Tariffs Dampen Near-Term Outlook
The discount retailer warned that tariff-related costs would pressure earnings in the near term, overshadowing an uptick in second-quarter sales.
----
Google's Big Win Is Even Bigger for Apple
A court ruling keeps the search giant intact while also allowing payments to the iPhone maker to continue at a vulnerable time.
(END) Dow Jones Newswires
September 03, 2025 17:15 ET (21:15 GMT)
